New Records: Finn Allen equalled the world record of 16 sixes in a T20I innings set by Hazratullah Zazai of Afghanistan and posted the highest score by a New Zealander in T20Is, beating Brendon McCullum's 123
Key Match Events: Pakistan was held to 179-7 in the run chase, losing by 45 runs to New Zealand
Babar Azam scored his third consecutive half century of the series, his sixth in succession batting at No. 6 in T20 internationals
Finn Allen hit two sixes that carried more than 100 meters and three that were hit so far out of the ground that the ball could not be found and had to be replaced
Post-Match Reflections: Finn Allen said 'It was good. I just tried to have a solid foundation and play good cricket shots' and 'What I've been working on is trying to have a solid foundation, a solid base and trying to build from there and hit the ball where it's supposed to go'
Miscellaneous Highlights: Pakistan has now won only one of its last eight T20 internationals as it heads towards this year's World Cup in the United States and Caribbean
New Zealand made 224-7 after being sent in by Pakistan for the third time in the series
